docblock.long-description: PHP service wrapper for the pushover.net API: https://pushover.net/api
PHP service wrapper for the pushover.net API: https://pushover.net/api

Can be 0 or 1. High-priority messages override a user's "quiet hours" setting and will always be delivered any time they are received. High priority messages are highlighted in red in the Android and iOS clients.

docblock.description: Include a Supplementary URL (up to 200 characters)
Title of the included URL (up to 50 characters)

tag.name: param
tag.description: Leave this empty if you want to send to all user's devices. This can be user specific!

docblock.long-description: Messages are stored on the Pushover servers with a timestamp of when they were initially received through the API. This timestamp is sent to and shown on client devices, and messages are listed in order of these timestamps. In most cases, this default timestamp is acceptable. This is not for scheduling!

tag.name: param
tag.description: Default = 0, if 1 the user's quiet hours will be ignored + messages displayed in red.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Add an url to your notification.

tag.name: param
tag.description: A title if you want to show a text instead of the actual url.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Enable this to receive detailed input and output info.

property.name: $input_option_array
property.default: array('debug' => array('short' => 'd', 'long' => 'debug', 'type' => '::'), 'verbose' => array('short' => 'v', 'long' => 'verbose', 'type' => '::'), 'config' => array('short' => 'c', 'long' => 'config', 'type' => ':'), 'tag' => array('short' => 't', 'long' => 'tag', 'type' => ':'), 'branch' => array('short' => 'b', 'long' => 'branch', 'type' => ':'), 'version' => array('short' => 's', 'long' => 'version', 'type' => ''))

docblock.long-description: 1) Parse arguments (done outside of the object) 2) set lock to prevent multiple instances 3) Load config 4) Init log level and set start msg 5) Check if required binairies exist 6) Check for free disk space 7) Sanity_info: check if all configuration options are filled in Check if user is root Check if mysql and git credentials are present
